pr_title: KAFKA-10366 & KAFKA-9649: Implement KIP-659 to allow TimeWindowedDeserializer and TimeWindowedSerde to handle window size

timeline.bodyText: The console consumer made this check necessary - if there's a simpler way to do this lmk
timeline.author: lct45

timeline.bodyText: Do you want to change this from Long.MAX_VALUE as well?
timeline.author: wcarlson5

replies.bodyText: I thought about it but figured since it's deprecated anyway and we want to keep backwards compatibility I would leave it. WDYT?
replies.author: lct45

replies.bodyText: You are probably right since we are deprecating it. But I don't have a strong opinion on this either way
replies.author: wcarlson5

timeline.bodyText: I don't think we should get rid of the generics unless we have to
timeline.author: wcarlson5

replies.bodyText: The window size has to be set either in the constructor or in the configs so if we use the generics we have to use the configs, but the general idea was to push users to do the constructor over the configs. Also in this scenario, I wanted to confirm that it would work fine without configs
replies.author: lct45

replies.bodyText: That is fine. but I think It should be like new TimeWindowedDeserializer<String>(windowedSerde.deserializer(), 500L) if that complies. We want to keep the type checking
replies.author: wcarlson5

timeline.bodyText: Why don't you use timeDifference like you did below?
timeline.author: wcarlson5

replies.bodyText: These are time windows so it would be windowSize, but I didn't write this test, just updated it to fit with the updated deserializer. I can switch it out to windowSize if you think it would help with readability, WYDT?
replies.author: lct45

replies.bodyText: It would probably be better practice but it's not necessary to fix. So if you feel like it
replies.author: wcarlson5
